ai-tika-vin11t14:1_1: If you show them to me, then you can give her a knife, and don’t show it to him, saying, ‘No.’
ai-tika-vin11t14:1_2: ‘If a nun who is not sick asks for one who is something else and says, “I’ll stay here,” “I’ll catch it,” then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-tika-vin11t14:1_3: who is not sick, and who is comfortable without ghee.
ai-tika-vin11t14:1_4: They formerly had just ghee, oil, and honey.
ai-tika-vin11t14:2_0: If she is sick, and she perceives her as such, and she gets sick, but she is unsure of it, and she transfers to another who is sick, then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-tika-vin11t14:2_1: As a sick person, they’re cart, minor,
ai-tika-vin11t14:2_2: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, and she transfers two, three, four, or five hundred carts.
ai-tika-vin11t14:3_1: until they get sick, they eat non-staple foods, drink, clothes, and vehicles; and they eat non-staple foods, relatives, or clans; and they eat non-staple foods, or meals without enemy, but the remainder of the day.
ai-tika-vin11t14:4_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-tika-vin11t14:5_0: Then he used the second group of thirty-first teachers, and so too for himself who were sick.
ai-tika-vin11t14:5_6: curd and then eats it, she must acknowledge it and have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.’
ai-tika-vin11t14:5_7: Three on the other sides are settled,
ai-tika-vin11t14:5_8: There is no other hand that belongs to the higher Blessed One. When there is no other state, he’s no other offense.
ai-tika-vin11t14:6_1: Putting taken to ghee, and they eat at all midday, and then 60 kilometers.
ai-tika-vin11t14:7_0: Failing to learn the Monastic Law,
ai-tika-vin11t14:8_0: The discussion on acknowledgment is finished.
